[Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/csc.html#csc.tools.AnimationPointsTypes "Permalink to this definition")

Class of basic types of points which physics tools and change through animation
for target center of mass it contains

get\_fulcrum\_points â all fulcrum point with collision
get\_fixed\_points â all points need to fix with collision
get\_local\_fixed\_points â points that should keep local coordinates after apply
get\_collision\_surface\_points â collision points with normal type
get\_collision\_pin\_points â collision points with pin type
get\_collision\_fixed\_points â collision points with fulcrum groups
get\_fulcrum\_floor\_points â points collide with only floor
get\_fixed\_floor\_points â points collide with only floor and fulcrum groups
get\_frame\_collision\_info\_points â collision info about points

Class of basic types of points which physics tools use and dont change through animation
for target center of mass it contains

get\_main\_points â all points that can be associated with center of mass
get\_direction\_controllers â all direction controller associated with center of mass
get\_interpolation\_group â all points that should be interpolated and use instead direction controller in apply

> Type of the parts, enum
>
> Elementary: includes only regular and setting functions + regular and setting data + connections that link them
> UpdateGroup: sub update groups and their elementary entities + connections that link them
> Object: includes all related entities of some object
> ObjectGroup: includes all objects and sub object groups and all related entities
> SelectedObjects: selected objects from different groups

Members:

> Elementary
>
> UpdateGroup
>
> Object
>
> ObjectGroup
>

Editor class

This class contains all methods and properties that need to edit the structure of scene objectsâ interpolation properties.
The structure is represented in the hierarchy of layers divided by folders.

Variables:

- **create\_folder** â name : string, parent : FolderId, withDefaultLayer : bool (true), pos : int or None, -> FolderId

- **create\_layer** â name : string, parent : FolderId, pos : int or None, -> FolderId

- **set\_fixed\_interpolation\_if\_need** â overridden method by ItemId, int, int \|\| LayerId, int (frame)

- **set\_fixed\_interpolation\_or\_key\_if\_need** â overridden method by LayerId, int, bool

_class_ csc.layers.Layer [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/csc.html#csc.layers.Layer "Permalink to this definition")

Layer class

The Layer is the basic element that implements intervals and sections to set
interpolation properties of scene objects

Variables:

- **header** â Get Header

- **is\_locked** â Get bool

- **is\_visible** â Get bool

[Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/csc.html#csc.domain.SelectorMode "Permalink to this definition")

> SelectorMode enumerable
>
> SingleSelection, // Resets if new objects were selected, and nothing changes if already selected ones were selected
>
> MultiSelection, // Multiple selections. If not all objects were selected, adds, otherwise subtracts
>
> NewSelection, // Resets everything and highlights the selection
>
> AdditionSelection, // Adds all selections to selections
>
> SubtractionSelection // Subtracts highlighted entities from selections

## csc.update The Cascadeur python module that implements basic update editor methods and its infrastructure. [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/csc.html\#csc-update-the-cascadeur-python-module-that-implements-basic-update-editor-methods-and-its-infrastructure "Permalink to this heading")

Update editor provides a node-like interface to edit data and setting graphs.
Naming conventions: regular means the same as data. It differs stuff from settings.

Additional functionality.
Update editor can be used to check what data functions will be active if you set some datas as actual.

_class_ csc.update.ActivityAttribute [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/csc.html#csc.update.ActivityAttribute "Permalink to this definition")

ActivityAttribute represents the activity of the data function.
It should be bool.
If true - function is active, if false - inactive. If not set - always active.
It is an input-only attribute.

InterfaceAttribute represents a group attribute.
Can be potentially connected to any attribute.

Interface attribute can be:
1\. An attribute of input/output node inside the group
2\. An attribute of the group node itself, in the parent group layout (outside the group)
We will call this attributes âpairedâ. For each attribute there is a paired one. They have the same attribute ids and names.
Sometimes itâs easier to think of them as of one attribute that has 2 sides. But in terms of this class this are two separate objects.

_class_ csc.parts.Type [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/_generate/csc.parts.Type.html#csc.parts.Type "Permalink to this definition")

> Type of the parts, enum
>
> Elementary: includes only regular and setting functions + regular and setting data + connections that link them
> UpdateGroup: sub update groups and their elementary entities + connections that link them
> Object: includes all related entities of some object
> ObjectGroup: includes all objects and sub object groups and all related entities
> SelectedObjects: selected objects from different groups

> Elementary

> UpdateGroup

# csc.tools.AnimationPointsTypes [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/_generate/csc.tools.AnimationPointsTypes.html\#csc-tools-animationpointstypes "Permalink to this heading")

_class_ csc.tools.AnimationPointsTypes [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/_generate/csc.tools.AnimationPointsTypes.html#csc.tools.AnimationPointsTypes "Permalink to this definition")

Class of basic types of points which physics tools and change through animation
for target center of mass it contains

get\_fulcrum\_points â all fulcrum point with collision
get\_fixed\_points â all points need to fix with collision
get\_local\_fixed\_points â points that should keep local coordinates after apply
get\_collision\_surface\_points â collision points with normal type
get\_collision\_pin\_points â collision points with pin type
get\_collision\_fixed\_points â collision points with fulcrum groups
get\_fulcrum\_floor\_points â points collide with only floor
get\_fixed\_floor\_points â points collide with only floor and fulcrum groups
get\_frame\_collision\_info\_points â collision info about points

Viewer class

This class contains all methods and properties that describe the structure of scene objectsâ interpolation properties.
The structure is represented in the hierarchy of layers divided by folders.

Variables:

- **top\_layer\_id** â overridden method by ItemId \|\| ItemId\[\]

- **merged\_layer** â overridden method like static and member LayerId\[\]

- **last\_key\_pos** â overridden method by LayerId\[\], -> Layer

- **frames\_count** â overridden method by LayerId\[\], -> int

- **significant\_frames** â overridden method by LayerId{}, -> int{}

# csc.layers.Editor [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/_generate/csc.layers.Editor.html\#csc-layers-editor "Permalink to this heading")

_class_ csc.layers.Editor [Â¶](https://cascadeur.com/python-api/_generate/csc.layers.Editor.html#csc.layers.Editor "Permalink to this definition")

Editor class

This class contains all methods and properties that need to edit the structure of scene objectsâ interpolation properties.
The structure is represented in the hierarchy of layers divided by folders.

Variables:

- **create\_folder** â name : string, parent : FolderId, withDefaultLayer : bool (true), pos : int or None, -> FolderId

- **create\_layer** â name : string, parent : FolderId, pos : int or None, -> FolderId

- **set\_fixed\_interpolation\_if\_need** â overridden method by ItemId, int, int \|\| LayerId, int (frame)

- **set\_fixed\_interpolation\_or\_key\_if\_need** â overridden method by LayerId, int, bool
